title: Brandi Carlile Returns to ‚ÄòSNL‚Äô to Perform Songs From ‚ÄòReturning to¬†Myself‚Äô
summary: This marks Carlile‚Äôs fourth time as musical guest on SNL and her second appearance this year, following an April duet with Elton John.
body: Brandi Carlile returned to Saturday Night Live on Nov. 2 with a commanding performance of ‚ÄúChurch & State‚Äù and ‚ÄúHuman,‚Äù both from her newly released solo album Returning to Myself . This marks Carlile‚Äôs fourth time as musical guest on SNL and her second appearance this year, following an April duet with Elton John promoting their joint project Who Believes in Angels? . On Saturday‚Äôs show, she took center stage solo, delivering two emotionally charged performances. Opening with ‚ÄúChurch & State,‚Äù Carlile sang of a ‚Äúfailing empire‚Äù and sociopolitical unrest in a haunting arrangement co-written with producer Andrew Watt and longtime collaborators Phil and Tim Hanseroth. She followed with ‚ÄúHuman,‚Äù a soaring ballad that reflects on vulnerability and resilience ‚Äî also the name of her upcoming Human Tour, which kicks off in February 2026. The two songs are from Carlile‚Äôs eighth studio album, Returning to Myself , released Oct. 25. It marks her first solo LP since 2021‚Äôs In These Silent Days , which peaked at No. 11 on the Billboard 200, topped the Rock and Americana/Folk charts, and won multiple Grammy awards, including Best Americana Album and awards for ‚ÄúBroken Horses.‚Äù It also ‚Ä¶

title: Jessica Simpson Marks 8 Years of Sobriety: ‚ÄòAlcohol Silenced My Intuition‚Äô
summary: ‚Äú8 years ago today I made the choice to confront, to confess and to let go of the self-sabotaging parts of my life that I was choosing,‚Äù Simpson wrote.
body: Jessica Simpson is celebrating eight years of sobriety. The singer, fashion entrepreneur and reality TV personality marked the milestone on Friday (Nov. 1) with a reflective Instagram post , sharing how giving up alcohol transformed her life and creativity. ‚Äú8 years ago today I made the choice to confront, to confess and to let go of the self-sabotaging parts of my life that I was choosing,‚Äù Simpson wrote. ‚ÄúMaking that decision allowed me to fully live in the pursuit of God‚Äôs purpose for my life. Alcohol silenced my intuition, blocked my dreams and chased my circulating fears of complacency.‚Äù She continued, ‚ÄúToday I am clear. Today I am driven by faith. Both fear and faith are something that we feel and may not see, I‚Äôm so happy I chose faith over fear. It was not in the fight that I found my strength, it was in the surrender.‚Äù View this post on Instagram A post shared by Jessica Simpson (@jessicasimpson) The ‚ÄúWith You‚Äù singer has been open about her journey to sobriety since revealing in her 2020 memoir Open Book that she quit drinking in 2017. Earlier this year, Simpson told The Cut that getting sober also reshaped her songwriting process. ‚ÄúEvery time I would write, I was a litt‚Ä¶

title: Tame Impala Resurrects ‚ÄòSundown Syndrome‚Äô at Halloween Barclays¬†Show
summary: Comedian and longtime Tame Impala fan Eric Andre made an unexpected cameo.
body: Tame Impala pulled a few tricks‚Äîand fan-favorite treats‚Äîout of the vault on Halloween night in Brooklyn. Related 6 Best Moments From Tame Impala’s Deadbeat Tour Opener in Brooklyn Mariah Carey Announces 'It's Time' for Christmas 2025 in Ad With Sephora Kali Uchis Named a 2025 ASCAP Women Behind the Music Honoree & More Uplifting Moments Kevin Parker brought his Deadbeat Tour to Barclays Center on Thursday (Oct. 31), performing the live rarity ‚ÄúSundown Syndrome‚Äù for the first time in seven years. The psych-pop gem, originally released as Tame Impala‚Äôs debut single in 2009, hadn‚Äôt appeared on a tour setlist since 2018. The moment came midway through night three of a four-night sold-out run at the arena, with Parker and his touring band all dressed in costumes nodding to Parker‚Äôs ‚Äúscarf-era‚Äù aesthetic from the early 2010s. The Halloween chaos didn‚Äôt stop there. Comedian and longtime Tame Impala fan Eric Andre made an unexpected cameo‚Äîinside the show‚Äôs bathroom cam. Parker has famously included a backstage toilet feed on tour to give fans a surreal behind-the-scenes moment mid-set. This time, Andre took over the screen, sharing a quick on-camera kiss with‚Ä¶

title: Drake Supports Hometown Blue Jays at Game 6 of the World¬†Series
summary: Also attending the game were Rush frontman Geddy Lee, Schitt‚Äôs Creek stars Eugene Levy and Annie Murphy and more.
body: Drake stepped out in full hometown hero mode on Halloween night (Oct. 31), attending Game 6 of the 2025 World Series at Rogers Centre in Toronto as the Blue Jays attempted to clinch their first championship since 1993. The rapper, who has been trolling Los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani on social media throughout the series, was among a stacked lineup of celebrities cheering on the Jays in their showdown against L.A. ‚ÄúOctober‚Äôs Very Own is back at the #WorldSeries,‚Äù MLB captioned a post on X , sharing footage of Drake arriving in the stadium. His appearance was part of a Halloween-night spectacle that included a who‚Äôs who of Canadian royalty and celebrity fans. Also attending the game were Rush frontman Geddy Lee, Schitt‚Äôs Creek stars Eugene Levy and Annie Murphy, former tennis pro Eugenie Bouchard, and Sliders actor Jerry O‚ÄôConnell. Baseball legends Paul Molitor and Jack Morris ‚Äî both World Series MVPs with the Blue Jays and Twins respectively ‚Äî were also spotted in the stands. Drake‚Äôs recent Instagram Story posts have only amplified his sports-fan persona. After Game 5, he shared a photo of Ohtani wearing a sweater vest, cheekily captioned ‚ÄúONE MORE!!!!!!!‚Äù before following ‚Ä¶

title: Mariah Carey Announces ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs Time‚Äô for Christmas 2025 in Ad With¬†Sephora
summary: Carey's holiday season welcome in partnership with Sephora co-stars Billy Eichner.
body: Mariah Carey ‘s welcome to the Christmas season is here. The “All I Want for Christmas Is You” hitmaker made an official announcement to kick off the holidays in partnership with Sephora. “Halloween slayed,” Carey says in the Joseph Kahn-directed ad that dropped as Halloween (Oct. 31) came to a close. “But now … it’s time!” There’s one problem: Someone’s rummaged through the pop diva’s Sephora bag and pilfered the new beauty goodies she snagged for the 2025 holidays. In the lighthearted spot, Carey demands someone spill the tea on who stole her makeup so she can ring in the season of her modern Christmas carol, and — spoiler alert — it’s not the Grinch. It’s Billy Eichner as an overworked elf advocating for better treatment at Christmastime. “Bad news, Mariah Carey,” the comedian taunts. “The elves are striking this year. Elf revenge for putting us through holiday hell! Santa’s helper quit. I’m pawning this so I can afford elf therapy!” “That’s my blush, elf boy,” Carey says. “Your lipstick? I’m taking it. No bells. No ch‚Ä¶

title: Kali Uchis Named a 2025 ASCAP Women Behind the Music Honoree & More Uplifting¬†Moments
summary: Plus, Lele Pons & Guaynaa celebrate their first Halloween as parents.
body: From career milestones to new music releases to major announcements and those little important moments,  Billboard  editors highlight uplifting moments in Latin music. Here‚Äôs what happened in the Latin music world this week. Kali Uchis to Receive Special Honor Kali Uchis has been named a 2025 ASCAP Women Behind the Music, alongside honorees Kehlani and KPop Demon Hunters‚Äô lead vocalist EJAE. ‚ÄúEvery year, ASCAP looks forward to spotlighting some of music‚Äôs most extraordinary women by honoring them for their achievements at our Women Behind the Music event,‚Äù said Nicole George-Middleton, ASCAP Executive Vice President & Head of Creative Membership, in a statement. ‚ÄúThis year we are thrilled to recognize three women who are pushing boundaries and capturing the world’s attention across different genres. Their creative success has propelled them to the top of the charts and is set to inspire the next generation of women in music.‚Äù The Colombian artist will receive her award at the 17 th annual ASCAP Women Behind the Music event, taking place Wednesday, Nov. 12 in Los Angeles, just weeks after her Superstar Q&A at the 2025 Billboard Latin Music Week in Miami last‚Ä¶
